intro: Geissorhiza ciliaris, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a South African plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is a bulbous perennial that produces striking, showy flowers with a distinctive red and yellow coloration. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is known for its ability to withstand drought conditions. Geissorhiza ciliaris is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
